• Announcement Type: Equity Incentive Plan (RSR Grant)
  • Key Points:
  • Genesis Energy Limited (GNE) issued 744,536 Restricted Share Rights (RSRs) convertible to ordinary shares under its Equity Incentive Plan.
  • No cash consideration; vesting is performance/employment-based.
  • Vesting Schedule:
    • 525,555 RSRs vest on 30 June 2028.
    • 218,981 RSRs vest on 30 June 2029.
  • Vesting contingent on CEO meeting performance/conduct criteria and Board discretion.
  • If fully vested, RSRs would equal 0.06% of total ordinary shares outstanding (1,100,616,362 shares).
  • No immediate liquidity or capital structure impact (minor dilution potential).

• Exploration Results Update:
  • Identification of a new large conductive zone (~7km²) via MT and seismic surveys, located ~3km northeast of drill hole VUD 008.
  • VUD 008 (drilled in 2011) intersected 179.75m of mineralized basement averaging 0.19% Cu, 0.10g/t Au, 0.02kg/t U3O8, and 68g/t Mo, with a higher-grade zone of 0.63% Cu, 0.28g/t Au.

  • Conductive zone extends ~4km northeast and is linked to a potential 5km-deep feeder structure (per MT data).

  • JORC Compliance: Re-release adds technical details to Table 1 (Appendix 1) but contains no new material data.

No capital markets or trading actions implied. Purely exploratory.

Material Information Summary: Capital Raising Announcement

1. Offer Structure

  • Share Purchase Plan (SPP):
  • Target Raise: $2.5 million (AUD).
  • Over-Subscriptions: Additional $7.5 million (up to $10.0 million total).
  • SPP Shortfall Offer: Unsubscribed shares may be placed with institutional investors.

2. Pricing

  • SPP Offer Price: The lower of:
  • Fixed price of $0.23 (Placement Offer Price), or
  • 5% discount to the 5-day VWAP before the Closing Date (rounded to nearest half-cent).

3. Key Dates

  • Record Date: 22 July 2025 (7:00 PM Melbourne time).
  • Opening Date: 1 August 2025.
  • Closing Date: 22 August 2025 (5:00 PM Melbourne time).
  • Results Announcement: 26 August 2025.
  • AGM Date: 27 August 2025 (SPP conditional on shareholder approval).
  • Trading of New Shares: Expected 1 September 2025.

4. Capital Structure Impact

  • Current Shares Outstanding: 486,477,023 (post-Unconditional Placement).
  • Maximum New Shares Under SPP: ~43.5 million (if $10.0 million raised at $0.23).
  • Market Cap at $0.23: Up to $124.6 million (if SPP reaches cap).

5. Use of Proceeds

  • Primary Allocation:
  • Clinical trials (ACCENT, AMPLICITY, kRAS, OVARIAN): ~$30.0 million.
  • Manufacturing (CMC): $6.0 million.
  • Working capital/offer costs: $6.7 million.

6. Risks Highlighted

  • Clinical trial failures, regulatory hurdles, R&D tax rebate dependency, and liquidity risks.

7. Other Key Points

  • Lead Manager: Bell Potter Securities (not underwritten).
  • No brokerage/stamp duty for SPP participants.
  • Scale-back: May apply to maintain shareholder proportional ownership.

Conclusion

The SPP offers eligible shareholders a chance to participate at a discounted price, with potential dilution for non-participants. Key risks include trial outcomes and funding sustainability. No material operational updates beyond the capital raise.

Material Information Summary for Trading & Capital Markets Decisions

1. Capital Raising & Financing (Key Updates)

  • Debt Refinancing:
  • Fully repaid $477M outstanding on the Mantoverde (MV) project finance facility ($334M Capstone share).

  • New $145M term loan for Mitsubishi Materials’ (MMC) 30% share, with a 2-year grace period.

  • Credit Facilities:

  • $1B revolving credit facility (RCF) amended, maturing May 2029 (previously $700M).
  • $600M in senior unsecured notes issued at 6.75% (due March 2033).
  • $795M undrawn RCF capacity as of June 30, 2025.

2. Operational & Financial Highlights (Q2 2025)

  • Production & Costs:
  • Copper production: 57,416 tonnes (Q2 2025) vs. 40,937 tonnes (Q2 2024), +40% YoY, primarily from MV sulphide ramp-up.
  • C1 cash costs: $2.45/lb (down from $2.80/lb YoY) due to higher output & lower unit costs.

  • Realized copper price: $4.39/lb ($4.53/lb in Q2 2024).

  • Financials:

  • Revenue: $543.2M (vs. $393.1M YoY).
  • Adj. EBITDA: $215.6M (vs. $123.1M YoY).
  • Net debt: $691.9M (down from $742.0M at Dec 2024).
  • Cash & liquidity: $311.6M cash + $795M undrawn RCF = $1.1B total liquidity.

3. Project Updates (Growth & Expansion)

  • Mantoverde Optimized (MV-O) Expansion:
  • Permit secured: DIA environmental approval received in July 2025.
  • Plan: Increase sulphide throughput (32k → 45k tpd), extend mine life (19 → 25 years).

  • Capital: $20M long-lead items approved; sanctioning decision expected Q3 2025.

  • Santo Domingo Project (Copper-Iron-Gold):

  • Feasibility Study (July 2024): $1.7B NPV (8%), 24.1% IRR (copper price: $4.10/lb).
  • Partnership: Advanced-stage discussions, announcement expected Q3 2025.

  • Capital: $2.3B initial capex (detailed engineering underway).

  • Cobalt Opportunity (MV-SD District):

  • Plan: 1,500 tpa cobalt initially (scalable to 4,500–6,000 tpa post-Santo Domingo).
  • Study completion: Late 2025.

4. 2025 Guidance Reiterated

  • Production: 220–255kt copper (H2-weighted due to mine sequencing).
  • Costs: C1 cash cost $2.20–$2.50/lb.
  • Capex: $315M sustaining/expansionary, $210M capitalized stripping, $25M exploration.

5. Key Risks & Catalysts Ahead

  • Pinto Valley challenges: Water constraints (Arizona drought); mitigation underway (full mill ops by Q3 2025).
  • Copper price volatility: Realized price $4.39/lb (Q2) vs. LME avg. $4.32/lb.
  • Sulphide ramp-up execution: MV and Mantos Blancos performing above plan.

Trading Takeaways:

✅ Bullish: Strong production growth, lower costs, solid liquidity, and strategic expansion (MV-O, Santo Domingo).
⚠️ Monitor: Execution risk on MV-O sanctioning, copper price trends, and near-term operational hiccups (Pinto Valley).

Conclusion: Capstone’s improved financial position and growth pipeline position it favorably, but market sensitivity to copper prices and project timelines remains key.
